timeline.message:
Deprecate Raw ZkClient in helix-core

We have moved the raw ZkClient to zookeeper-api. As such, we need to deprecate the old one in helix-core. We are leaving the class for backward-compatibility purposes.

timeline.bodyText: Do we still need these constructors in old file? Or we can just leave the class purely extend what we have in zookeeper-api module?
timeline.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: Don't you think we should keep all public constructors for backward-compatibility?
replies.author: narendly

replies.bodyText: Oh. The move also involve some constructor change? Then I am OK for that.
replies.author: junkaixue

timeline.bodyText:
I think in the test we can just call Long.toHexString(sessionId).
Otherwise, my concern is that this public API will be with the ZkClient forever... And it seems to an overkill to have such a public method in the ZkClient class.
timeline.author: jiajunwang

replies.bodyText: I agree with this idea. I think it's a valid point to avoid introducing another public method for ZkClient.
replies.author: narendly

timeline.bodyText:
Can we merge 2 helpers? Maybe not a good idea.
But when we have both TestHelper and ZkTestHelper in the Zookeeper module, they are kind of confusing. Maybe a pair of better names would help.
timeline.author: jiajunwang

replies.bodyText: On this point, I thought about it, but I decided to keep them separate because 1) It is less confusing - TestHelper solely provides methods around testing and TestNG, and ZkTestHelper provides methods related to ZK operations. 2) From the dev perspective, we get less confused (why are there 2 helpers in helix-core vs 1 helper in zookeeper-api?) and 3) it helps us keep the classes small.
replies.author: narendly

replies.bodyText: Sure, I didn't find any better name either...
replies.author: jiajunwang
